This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the California Accidental Release Prevention Program (CalARP), CCR Title 19, Chapter 4.5 and the California Process Safety Management Program, CCR Title 8, Section 5189 as enforced by the local Certified Unified Program Agency and the Fed/EPA.  

This program is intended to be a Â¿living document.Â¿  As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible. To accomplish this elements have been organized in a way that is consistent with the corporate organization, how frequently different elements are accessed, and who needs to refer to the program.  The order of elements within this organization is not the same as they are listed in the regulations, and in some cases portions of elements may be found in more than one location.   

1.	THE  GIUMARRA VINEYARDS, WINERY, RISK & PROCESS SAFETY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM
This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Giumarra Vineyards, Winery has updated their unified Risk & Process Safety Management Program.  The program is in compliance with CaliforniaÂ¿s Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program (in California

CCR Title 19, Chapter 4.5 Program Level 3 Elements.  At the Federal level, Title 40 CFR Part 68, and California OSHAÂ¿s Â¿Process Safety Management (PSM) of Acutely Hazardous MaterialsÂ¿ standard (in California CCR Title 8, Section 5189, Â¿Process Safety Management of Acutely Hazardous Materials,Â¿ and Federally Title 29 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 1910.119).  This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities:

1.	West Winery Refrigeration (Process ID#9) Â¿ Refrigeration system with anhydrous ammonia in an amount in excess of 500 lbs, but less than 10,000 lbs.
2.	East Winery Refrigeration (Process ID#10) Â¿ Refrigeration system with anhydrous ammonia in an amount in excess of 500 lbs, but less than 10,000 lbs.
3.	Aqueous Ammonia Tank (Process ID#12) Â¿ Filter regeneration process with aqueous ammonia (29.4% conc.).  Ammonia in the solution is in excess of 500 lbs, but less than 20,000 lbs.
4.	Grape Crush SO2 Addition Â¿ (Process ID#13) Â¿ Injection system with sulfur-dioxide in an amount in excess of 5,000 lbs.

Our program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries and illnesses and avoid physical property damage.

Our company has an exemplary safety record, one that we are quite proud of. Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety.  We have: (1) prepared a unified program based on the PSM plan to meet CalARP obligations as well; (2) reorganized the program so that it meshes more closely with general Giumarra Vineyards, Winery business practices; and (3) reviewed plan documentation forms and responsibilities.  The unified Risk & Process Safety Management Plan sets forth

rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees protect themselves and our neighbors.

2.	PROCESS DESCRIPTIONS
The Giumarra Vineyards, Winery facility is a processing facility for grape juice concentrate products.  The facility has two ammonia processes that provide refrigeration capacity to multiple product chillers, an aqueous ammonia storage tank which is part of a carbon filter regeneration process, and a sulfur-dioxide injection process for grape juice.

3.	GENERAL ACCIDENT RELEASE & CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS
3.1 General.
We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of any one of the regulated chemicals in annual pre-season safety meetings.  These employees are made aware of the potential risks of the process chemicals involved.  During these meetings we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Giumarra Vineyards, Winery has also conducted an off-site impact analysis of worst-case and alternate-case release scenarios for each process.  These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release.  The results of the analysees are reported in the body of the program.

3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia.
The ammonia refrigeration systems at the Giumarra Vineyards, Winery facility are an integral part of the overall business and operate most of the year.   The West Winery Process contains a total charge of approximately 9,900 lbs and the East Winery Process contains approximately 5,900 lbs. It is extremely important that these systems are maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner.  Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration processes and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia.  In addition, the processes are checked frequently by one of t

he outside refrigeration contractors that we use.  These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity review of our ammonia equipment.

3.3 Aqueous Ammonia.
The aqueous ammonia process at the Giumarra Vineyards, Winery facility is an integral part of the grape juice concentrate manufacturing process and operates year round.   The ammonia concentration in the solution is 29.4% and the Storage Tank has a 5,000 gal capacity.  As with the ammonia systems management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an aqueous ammonia leak.

Giumarra Vineyards personnel monitor the aqueous ammonia process and storage tank.  In addition, the tank is checked by the vender supplying the aqueous ammonia.  The vender also assists in performing the annual mechanical integrity review of our aqueous ammonia equipment.

3.4 Sulfur-Dioxide.
The sulfur-dioxide injection process at the Giumarra Vineyards, Winery facility is an integral part of the juicing process for grapes.  Injection of the grapes takes place during the initial crush which operates four months out of the year.   The process involves multiple 1 ton containers with a maximum intended inventory of 20,000 lbs.  Two injection points are operated with one container connected at each point.  It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner.  Giumarra Vineyards is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of exposure to sulfur-dioxide.

Our refrigeration personnel also monitor the sulfur-dioxide injection process and keep an active log of all associated procedures and transactions.  In addition, the process is checked frequently during the season by the outside contractor that supplies the SO2 containers.  Snowden also assists in performing the annual mechanical integrity review of our system/process equipment. 

4.	FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
Giumarra Vineyards, Winery has no

t had any reportable releases in the last five years. 

5.	EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN
This facilityÂ¿s emergency response program is based on the Cal/OSHA requirements for Emergency Action Plans (in California CCR Title 8, Section 3220, Â¿Emergency Action Plans.Â¿  Federally, Title 29 CFR 1910.38 and 1910.119), HAZWOPER (standard (in California CCR Title 8, Section 5192, Â¿Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response,Â¿ and Title 29 CFR 1910.120). 

Strategically, we will respond Â¿minimallyÂ¿ to a release.  Under this plan we will call emergency personel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Kern County Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team.

Every year at the beginning of the season we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including an hazardous chemical release. 

6.	PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
Our company has an outstanding safety record, one that we are quite proud of.  Many policies and procedures have been implemented to promote overall plant, worker and public safety.  Nevertheless, Giumarra Vineyards, Winery continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.  The overhaul of this Risk & Process Safety Management Program has been the primary recent improvement, and implementation of the program is our plan for improved safety in the near future.

The Risk & Process Safety Management Program has been written so that program elements are aligned with Giumarra Vineyards, Winery business practices rather than the order presented in the law.  Thus, Safe Operating Procedures are grouped together for the benefit of our system operator.  Safe Operating Policies are grouped together so that appropriate office staff may administer them.  The Emergency Action Plan is now separated out and distributed widely through the plant for easy reference.  

The Risk & Process Safety Management Program documentation forms and company policy forms

pertaining to employee, contractor, and community safety have been carefully reviewed so as to prevent unnecessary complexity and redundancy.  Our operators have assisted in the writing of Standard Operating Procedures, and they are presented in a format that is easy to use.  

For the future, Giumarra Vineyards, Winery now thinks of the Risk & Process Safety Management Program as a Â¿living documentÂ¿.  It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Giumarra Vineyards, Winery employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement.  Through the Risk & Process Safety Management Program Giumarra Vineyards, Winery will continue to maintain overall plant, worker and public safety.
